Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We are actively developing the EOS games, the exchange we had wanted to list on did not turn out to be a safe place so we abandoned that idea. We'll go for other, better exchanges once we have something running on EOS.  You can follow us on twitter and on telegram, there has been more activity from the Billionaire Token team in here.  Quote from: fishfishfish313 on April 11, 2018, 04:42:14 PM Gluedog, any news on the migration to the EOS platform?  Or any other updates at this time?  The first step of the migration to EOS will be a coin swap. This will happen shortly after the launch of the EOS main net.  The Billionaire Token EOS coin swap will be done automatically by Smart Contracts. The only requirements are an existing EOS account, Chrome and Metamask. You will then have to access our website, click a few buttons and you are all set for the swap.  48 days left until that: https://eoscountdown.com/  The tokens that remain un-swapped will be burned as an offering to the market gods, further diminishing the supply of Billionaire Tokens. Are we going to see under three million? We think so.

Author: vladameier
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Before asking a question, I read it:  "The move to the EOS blockchain will require XBL holders to participate in a coin swap.  There will be a new page on the Billionaire Token website. This page will be connected to a Smart Contract. Users will be required to call a function on the Smart Contract that will log their EOS account name and freeze their XBL. This will all be done via metamask and an easy-to-use web interface.  Once the users have succesfully completed the required steps, they will be eligible to receive the new Billionaire Tokens, on the EOS Blockchain.  More information will be available as we get closer to the coin swap date. The EOS main net is set to launch in June 2018"   Can anybody answer me?  When you connect the platform EOS, the token can no longer be stored in wallet (myetherwallet)? The token will remain as before (STANDARD ERC20 )? The standard will then change or remain ERC20?  Please do not tell me that I do not understand well. I do not understand English well and read three times?

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: ERC20 is an Ethereum Token standard. It will have nothing to do with EOS token standards.

Author: vladameier
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Did you mean it: So the coin (XBL) changes the standard and I can not keep it in my wallet myetherwallet?

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: As explained on the FAQ page, you will be required to register the XBL you have in MyEtherWallet to a Smart Contract, along with your EOS account name.  After this, you will automatically receive the new XBL on the EOS blockchain.

Apparently, the extra coin problem is well-known, it happened with other coins on Crypto-Bridge as well. Some people claiming they deposited litecoins and got credited six-seven times what they deposited - free coins, thanks to Crypto-Bridge!  In my opinion, they are completely liable for the damages that have been caused. Also, I have not been officially contacted by Crypto-Bridge regarding these allegations. This is all just baseless FUD, you guys just need a scape goat and have found me.  I am very happy that I found out about the Crypto-Bridge problem, because we have removed them from the list of future exchanges. It would have been very bad if the Crypto Bridge decided to give everyone free, fake XBL, wouldn't it now?  Ultimately, I wouldn't blame anyone but yourselves if I was you. In crypto land, especially in "decentralized exchange" land, it's every man for himself. So if something like this happens, you should just suck it up and move on.  I personally lost a lot of money in a flash-crash on Bitfinex. Was it fair ? No. Was it market manipulation ? Probably. Did I cry ? No. Did I make a huge deal out of it and started accusing people ? No. I kept my chin up and carried on. Have a spine!  I love the red writing guys. But please let's keep things on-topic here from now on.

Body: Alive and kicking. Everyone is mostly on the telegram group. You are also invited to join, but please read the rules before you post: https://t.me/Billionaire_Token  Quote from: MrPuffnStuff on January 19, 2018, 11:13:58 PM Is there a reason the Github hasn't been active in a long time?  We have some private repositories that will be made public at a later date. These repos contain Graphical User Interface data and website data.  Right now we are still pretty much testing and learning EOS features, we will port the token and the Raffle&Burner on EOS, test it, once we have a working model to go with we will create repositories and start working on the production versions of these pieces of software.  We think the wait for the EOS main net launch will be very much worth it. We're looking at Edgeless at the moment, they can't even launch their platform because of "Ethereum blockchain congestion". So it could be worse than having to wait until Summer for the EOS launch - we could still be developing on Ethereum.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Updated FAQ page on website to provide information about the move to the EOS blockchain:  https://billionairetoken.com/faq     Black jack, roulette, games like these are played against the house. We don't want to have a house, this would require the need to have a steady supply of XBL in the House account. This would also mean that we, the Billionaire Token team would be taking some profits.  We do not want to take any sort of fees or profits from the casino. We also do not want to have to keep the House account filled with XBL at all times, as this is a point of failure for a decentralized casino - what if there is not enough money in the House account to pay the players ?  We are only implementing player vs player games: Like Cee-Lo dice, the Raffle, Poker.  After we are done with the platform, we want it to be a self-sustaining, autonomous Casino. So even if the Billionaire Token team goes out of business, the casino will still be there.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Feedback like yours means a lot to me. Thanks!  Quote Gives me more to buy tokens while they're still affordable aha. When we are converted to the EOS network will our tokens be affected by means of a fork? Or will the tokens be the same with just the platform that changes?  Different network. Not a fork. A fork is a network split on the same network. Like Ethereum Classic and Ethereum. Or Bitcoin Cash and Bitcoin.  What we are doing here has nothing to do with a fork.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Once we have at least one or two games running smoothly on EOS we can start an aggresive advertising campaign on twitter/facebook/Coinmarketcap and more. Until then we shall keep a low profile, we wouldn't want to start promoting ourselves right now, the Raffle and Burner are barely in beta stages and still have much improvement to see.   Please keep up the good work and let us know how can we help.  Not to forget, out of curiosity, why EOS? I hope you are aware that just about the time EOS will have mainnet way more competitive blockchains with their mainnet will appear, to name few: Universa and Credits. I hope if necessary you will find easy to migrate there. Alpha versions are realeased and it seems it would be extremely easy to build on them as well as fast and economic to execute.  Let me ask you, how do you know Universa and Credits are faster? Because they say so? AFAIK EOS has the biggest developer community outside Ethereum, and also the biggest potential and it seems now they will be the first to market with this amazing network that will probably take a lot of market share away from Ethereum.  Quote from: MrUnconventional on January 09, 2018, 10:56:55 PM I love randomly stumbling onto projects like this!  Looks like a lot of potential with this platform, especially on EOS.      @ Developer:  - Are there plans to hire or form a marketing team for this project?  - Please consider getting on Binance. They have come a long way, have massive volume and there's rumor that they are going to turn their exchange into a DEX.  Keep up the awesome work, looking forward to see how the future rolls out for XBL.  We have a marketing team.  We shall consider getting on Binance, now is not the time for that, though.

Author: Clawing Profits
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Part of the reason I like gaming coins such as XBL is they are unfairly low priced by the market right now. Seems like the Crypto market is run by tech nerds and Nasdaq types who will over value anything with either new tech and or alleged "business solutions". "All companies are going to want to put their documents on random cryptocurrencies from the internet cause muh blockchain and blockchain is the future." Or some such thinking. The market is oversaturated with this kind of stuff right now IMO.  If I'm going to hold something remotely long term I like a use case and I can't think of a use case more likely to catch on than online gaming. It's arguably one the most likely if not the most likely to see massive growth in the next few years. It's like a lot of people can't comprehend that there are a lot of regular people out there who don't care about the latest in tech, privacy or "business solutions" they just want to play poker. And in the not so distant future it's normal people not the crowd that's in crypto right now that will set prices.  The amount of coins here is already tiny at a little over 3milly and only getting smaller from here on out thanks the raffle system you have come up with. I'm very happy with the progress so far. I of course don't know for sure if you guys have what it takes to build the gaming platform you promised but judging buy the progress you've made since I've been here with the raffle and website I feel I have reason to be hopeful. If people want sell for this cheap I'm happy to take their coins. The risk vs reward ratio is rather good here IMO.  Not exactly putting all my money on this but at these prices I don't have to spend much to get a solid chunk.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We have already started setting up our development environment for EOS, the blockchain on which we will release the Billionaire Cee-Lo Dice and the Billionaire Hold'em Poker. Before that, we will port the Become a Billionaire Raffle on the EOS blockchain as well.  The EOS main net launch is set to happen sometime in Summer 2018 (their ICO ends June 2018). Once the main net is launched we will be holding a coin swap to the new EOS chain, and port our games.  We can, in the meanwhile, develop and test on the EOS testnet, we do not have to wait for Summer 2018 to start developing on EOS, but we do have to wait until then to port our games there and hold the coin swap.  Things to expect until then, are a better Raffle Graphical Interface for the Become a Billionaire Raffle, the start of our marketing campaign and much more. More information to come after the start of 2018.  Merry Christmas everybody!

Author: BillyYank
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: I will agree as well. I love all the elements and front end development that has taken place. Could we maybe put together a list of forums or relevant online communities for us to start getting conversations going? Maybe even put together some Youtube vids of player experiences once the raffle and games are in full swing. I think the one thing missing from most of the coins is a need for it. I helped with IFC back in '14 and we had lots of cool ideas and even a nice website. I was researching promotional materials such as key drives loaded with IFC to give away at conventions and some other things. In any case, the one thing that was missing no matter how shiny we polished that turd(51% attack recently) was any reason to even have it. All of the coins said they were the next best thing, but why? In the case of XBL, there is a legit use for it and without it people can't participate in the games and raffles. I think a crucial part of its evolution will be a mobile app that allows the playing of the games.  So again, kudos and thank you to the entire team.

Author: BeetlejuiceFL
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hey gluedog,  If I check your webpage right now, I see that I registered a total of 10 tickets for the raffle. How is that possible if maximum is 5 tickets per person?  Anyhow, imho, for the future development, I would skip the ticket price of 10 XBL and make it very simple: 1 ticket = 1 XBL. Don't know if that works on the Ethereum Main Network, but it would make the game much more transparent, and for the players, if you increase the limit to 50 instead of 5, it would make no difference. (In addition, you don't have the problem with the value of the ticket because each participant in the raffle can choose itself.)  Kind regards

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We had a small bug that allowed players to register 10 tickets for the Raffle, this has been fixed and will not be possible in the next version.  We are now at 1300/2500 tokens registered for the Raffle. There is a very high chance of everything working out and having three winners. If everything goes well this time we will finally deploy the Raffle and the Burner on the Ethereum Main Net shortly thereafter.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The thing about resetting the Raffle is that I've built all the Raffle reset, winner selection, winner payout, burning coins functionalities inside the registerTickets() function. Someone would have to call this function after the time resets to reset the Raffle.  Smart Contracts can't really do things on their own. They rely on outside stimulation to function. They are passive and not active.  This being said: We can implement a timer, of course. Just keep in mind that you'll still need to register tickets one time, after the timer expires to trigger the winner payout mechanism.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Our whole project and the token will grow, I think, because the token has a use-case. As long as our games are attractive and fair, I think people will want to play them. And in order to play the games, they have to have Billionaire Tokens.  And then there's the burning part, that goes hand in hand with people playing our games. The burning will make Billionaire Tokens rarer and rarer, this should theoretically increase the price of each token.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: If we ever get dangerously low because of the burning, we'll just start burning less and less coins. When we get to that stage, our coin will be very mature and probably the burning will not be as effective as it will be now, in the inception phase - and so it should not be a problem to reduce the burning, gradually so as to not affect the economy of the coin.  Either way, we will not even think about reducing burning until at least half of the coins have already been destroyed as an offering to the market gods!

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hello guys & gals!  This week's test Raffle ... also got stuck  I have some more ideas how to split the execution among several transactions as to try and avoid this situation, but this will require a little bit more time to test and develop.   So what happens now? Since we have a new website release in 7 days and we want to have a working Raffle & Burner by then - we have decided that we will first implement a simpler Raffle.  What is a simpler Raffle ?  This Raffle will have a maximum of 10 tickets per person (per Ethereum Address) and a maximum of 250 total tickets registered at once. Once this limit is hit, the Raffle will reset. We will test this 250 ticket limit on Kovan before deploying on the Main Net.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hey guys!  So apparently ETH can only handle so many computations in a single transaction.  The first iteration of the test Raffle was a success, we had three winners. The second iteration (this one that we're on right now) however, we've had a few more tickets registered and a few more unique players and:    Having to trigger the Raffle Reset function, we sent the maximum allowable gas for a block and we still encountered the out of gas error. A simple computation, that your laptop can do in under 0.5 seconds, the ETH network can not handle due to its sluggish nature.  This being said however, I already have some ideas on how to get a working version of the Raffle:  We can optimize the Raffle code, to loop more efficiently and thus take less processing time, but that still won't give us an unlimited number of players, the ETH Network will still have its limits. After optimizing the Raffle we could go even further and split the winner selection loops into three separate transactions. And then ultimately, we can just have the Raffle auto reset itself after a certain number of tickets have been registered, making sure that we are never in any danger of having the Raffle stuck like we have here. This will increase the player&ticket limit, while ensuring that the Raffle Reset transaction will never run out of gas.  Now... The Raffle will work after a few little programming tricks and everyone will be happy, but I think we have to understand that ultimately, the underlying problem here is that the Ethereum Network is way too slow to have any real large scale DAPPS built on it.  This is one of the key reasons I am such a big advocate for moving over all of our infrastructure to a new, faster Decentralized Application Blockchain - like EOS. If EOS delivers what is in their roadmap, then problems like these will be a thing of the past. We'll be talking about this like we are talking right now about ancient slow PCs ("Remember when they had a 2 MB Hard Drive the size of a truck back in the day?" - this is Ethereum in its current state a little bit further down the road).

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hello everyone!  We are very happy to announce that the Graphical User Interface for the Raffle is up-and-running on https://BillionaireToken.com/Raffle .  In order to play it you will need to setup your Metamask account to be running on the Kovan Test Network.  Afterwards you will need some Kovan Ethereum and Kovan XBL. To get both, you need to:  Follow BillionaireTkn on Twitter and tweet your reply on https://twitter.com/BillionaireTkn/status/923207113379336192 with your Kovan Ethereum Address to receive your Test XBL and Test Ethereum to participate in the first ever public version of the Become a Billionaire Raffle!   Here is a more in-depth tutorial on how to get everything set-up: https://BillionaireToken.com/RaffleTest.pdf   Testing this way on the Kovan network allows us to improve our product quality before having it running in a production environment (on the Mainnet).  We will continue testing the Raffle until our new website is finished (about 50-60% done at this moment), Afterwards we will deploy the Raffle (with an improved GUI than what is available now) on the Main Ethereum Network and will list on the cryptocurrency exchange Coinexchange.io .

Body: It's about time you ditch Ethereum and its silly Proof of Work consensus. That stupid chain can't handle more than 30 transactions per second, being blocks found every 5 minutes... It won't scale no matter what for AT LEAST 3~5 years, NO WAY a massive multiplayer gaming platform can run under that crap.  I would be very interested in increasing my exposure to your token if this shift to EOS were to happen!  Very good news, keep it up!

Alternatively, you can also check to see how many tokens are in circulation by consulting Etherscan, specifically the following link: https://etherscan.io/token/0x49aec0752e68d0282db544c677f6ba407ba17ed7 .  Code: Total Supply: 3,315,371.9999 XBL ($585,279.20)   I have updated the Raffle code on GitHub.  Quote Removed the different ticket price when DEBUG was active. Added functionality for lastweek_winner variables. Updated version to 0.9.5 .  These are the last test iterations before production deployment.  Our new website is also coming along very very well. We will want to time the release of our new website together with the release of the Raffle and the listing on Coinexchange.

Author: BerkelCrypto
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hi Gluedog,  Regarding the poker game; will the users of the game be able to buy XBL tokens to play in the game itself? Or do they need to have some crypto knowledge for buying them first on the exchange?

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The initial versions of the Billionaire Hold'em game will require some Crypto knowledge in order to obtain the XBL Tokens.  We want to make it as easy as possible, though, for our customers to play our games, and as such we will implement a very easy-to-use graphical system where users will be able to obtain the XBL tokens by the click of the button. The requirements ? To have the metamask chrome plugin installed, and some ETH in your metamask wallet.  Quote MetaMask is an extension for accessing Ethereum enabled distributed applications, or "Dapps" in your normal Chrome browser!  The extension injects the Ethereum web3 API into every website's javascript context, so that dapps can read from the blockchain.

Author: Yankeeruinx
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: ICO was scheduled to finish at the end of September, it's now beginning of October. In the week or so it has finished they have listed on an exchange and CMC, and have had solid progress on their Github. How much progress do you expect them to make in that period of time?  Makes me laugh that people come here demanding an instant product as soon as an ICO has ended like they can just magically make one appear, the point of an ICO is to raise the funds needed to develop the product.  Most ICO's when they finish they don't have anything for months, Edgeless is one I have been following that is in the same market as XBL. ICO finished in March and they have a very simple website that doesn't really tell you anything and they still do not have a finished product. However they have a $70 million marketcap.  I am very happy with the progress XBL has made in a short amount of time, soon they will have a product in the burner and raffle to give XBL a use. Then hopefully by the end of next month the GUI, dice games and new website tying it all together, after that there is Poker by the end of the year hopefully and many more games in the future. So when you compare them to Edgeless they are miles ahead of schedule and their marketcap is tiny so the returns for us on the ground floor of this project will be huge within a relatively short period of time.

Author: Champion123
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: It's astonishing how many people you are blatantly lying to and how many of them actually believe you... A large team? Give us a break, you are just 1-2 developers, probably working in the basement with no office at all. If you were a large team working on several projects at once, you would have revealed yourselves by now, not hiding behind the curtains. But of course since the end goal is to suck in as much money as possible from investors, it does no good to you revealing who you really are in your life.  Oh and to everyone else calling me a FUD-er, take a quick look at the price now - it has crashed so hard EXACTLY like I said it would. You see now why I was selling when I did that it was almost the peak? Because I knew the price would crash down later on. Anyone with half a brain could have predicted that. So, I sold off everything and bought them back 3x cheaper and gonna sell them high again. I wasn't the only person selling off and buying cheaper that day. Many of the so called "Hodlers" did that too, because they knew the price would come down to ~ ICO price few days later. I didn't need FUD for that, it happened on its own. Yet, that day I was crucified as a FUD-er by people clearly invested in this so hard they let go of logic for a while and give in to emotions (so biased). The "future billionaire richness" has clouded all of your judgments.  Anyway, let's suppose for a moment I am indeed a FUD-er and that I am doing everything I can to bash this project. Let's also suppose this whole project isn't an elaborate P&D scheme to suck in all money from investors (the way I see it this has already been happening in Cryptopia via bots that no one knows whose control they are under). Let's suppose it's real and the developers are really working hard. Then can any enlightened person explain to me why a huge team like this one is still a shadow with no names given at all? There is absolutely NO reason for a company to withhold team info especially in the crypto world, where a team and a whitepaper only receive valuations in the millions. The ONLY reason is if you are going to participate in fraud.  So, here is the deal - answer to me that question with an answer that makes sense and I will leave this thread forever. I actually wanted to, but just returned to tell people here "I told you so" about my price predictions a few days ago - I was right and I was called a FUD-er. Answers that make sense also do NOT include:  1) He will reveal himself and his team after the ICO is over - gluedog's words, lies so far. 2) He will reveal himself and his team when he quits his job in real life since this is a side project for him and not sure if it ever will get traction - more lies. The project got more than enough traction (my very reason why I am writing such a long ass post right now) raised almost $200K and according to the developer and speculators here the coin will hit the moon after the games are released, meaning the coins the developer is holding will be worth hundreds of thousands or even millions later down the road. So, you are telling me with all these benefits and since the ICO went better than gluedog's expectations (guess he didn't think there were so many stupid people around), he still has not quit his job?  Put yourself in his shoes. You are given a project like this one, $200K to use as funds to develop the project and you can't even make an effort to show your team because you still haven't quit your job? Is this really an answer that makes sense to each and everyone of you invested in this? It sure as hell doesn't in my book. If it does for you, then I have no doubt your account is just an alt of gluedog's, especially since most accounts posting in here are new (yeah I know including me). No investor in their right mind would never question the team's existence or ask about it, ever! The team is the first thing everyone asks, but here in this thread/ANN/project, it doesn't seem to make a difference at all. Wondering why...  P.S. Let the anti-FUD wars against me continue (because I am a FUD-er for predicting what will happen to the market LMAO), but seriously answer my question above if you can!

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The weasel fighting game is just an idea in the back of my head, which I want implemented. That or an RPG on the blockchain. I will probably do both.  Keep in mind this will not affect the development of the DICE game or the Billionaire Hold'em. We have separate teams working on different projects. We will obviously focus on our initial roadmap (Raffle / Burner > DICE > Poker) as these are our #1 priority.  But since we have quite a large team and many ideas, so the Fighting Game is something that we will be able to do, with no delays to our original roadmap. This should give us a tiny bit of an edge against the competition as well!

Author: don2018
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The raffle represents the core deflationary mechanism of Billionaire Token. Every week, people will be able to submit 20 XBL to an Ethereum Smart Contract address - this is the equivalent of buying one ticket. More tickets will mean a better chance at winning. At the end of each week, three lucky winners will become Billionaires! First place gets 40% of all the tokens that were raised during that week, second place gets 20% and third place gets 10%. From the remaining 30% of the tokens: 10% are burned - as an offering to the market gods. The other 20% are sent to an Ethereum Smart Contract Address that works like a twisted faucet, rewarding people for burning their coins. The winner selection is completely random, and the code is open for everyone to read. Because the raffle itself lies on the Ethereum Network, it is self-sufficient. Once deployed, it will work forever.

Author: goingmobile
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Sad to see all the negativity in this thread.  People have a right to be suspicious until they see a product on the table. However, there are a glut of coins with no product and vague plans, so I think the patience is more likely to be worth it than not for this project since the plans are extremely clear. This is why I took the risk in the first place.  This is an extremely low cap project, so if you are truly not comfortable holding until you see a product then you have very low risk tolerance and I am rather confused why and how you ended up in the coin at this point. If you are all in on it or something hoping for a profit... well then I have no idea why you waited to take your profits. If you bought in at ICO prices, & are not comfortable with holding long, you can do something like take out half and ride out the rest for a while. If you went heavy on this after ICO price and did not understand it can take a while to make games... well look at every other gaming coin lol.  I agree the same few people are doing their best to pump up the product... it started with a $200K cap! Nobody knows it exists. While their shilling is surely in large part self-interest (a self-interest I can hardly deny), but there are not many people to shill so of course it is just the same few people.  Anyway sorry if this post is scattered, I tried my best to address any points I could think of. If you think anything I said was invalid I am happy to talk about it more, not because I want to bump the thread or think I am some magical voice of reason; if I got anything wrong I would just love to hear why.

Body: Nice!!  Other projects take note.  It does not take much to keep investors and supporters happy.  Give them updates on a regular basis and interact with the community.  It may be "nothing too fancy" but its progress . . and quick progress.    Quote from: goingmobile on September 25, 2017, 03:00:56 AM  This is an extremely low cap project, so if you are truly not comfortable holding until you see a product then you have very low risk tolerance and I am rather confused why and how you ended up in the coin at this point. If you are all in on it or something hoping for a profit... well then I have no idea why you waited to take your profits. If you bought in at ICO prices, & are not comfortable with holding long, you can do something like take out half and ride out the rest for a while. If you went heavy on this after ICO price and did not understand it can take a while to make games... well look at every other gaming coin lol.   This imo is a very good explanation of the mindset of different types of investors. Shoot, if we take the current price of ~8100 sats = .30 cents, that's already a 3x from the ICO price of .10 cents, without the bonus  We have raffle code being worked on, more people added to the team.  A roapmap was typed out by Gluedog a couple pages back.  I'm not sure what else can be done to make it any better at this stage.  Anyone who happened to find this coin early and bought in, just dinged the register.  My only regret, of course, is not buying more    Again, great job!  Feel free to come in the Slack and hang with us     https://billionairetoken.herokuapp.com/

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hello everyone, we have decided to make the following changes to the Raffle and the Burner:  1. Only people that had played the raffle the previous week, will be able to register coins to the Burner 2. People will only be able to register to the burner at the most, +5% what they put in the raffle  This is done so that someone with an automated script can't just always take the burner reward. We would then have a lot of unhappy people, and a lot of happy scripters.      Hey,  Raffle and Burner should be implemented this week. If everything goes to plan. We have decided last night to make these last-minute changes, which should delay the deployment but not by much, we should still be able to do it sometime this week. Keep in mind, we will not deploy these until we are 100% sure that they are tested and secure.  For the advertising we have a few things in store. If you have a little bit of patience you're going to see something that, we think, is pretty awesome!  This winter we'll be having a very merry Christmas.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: I've made it so because I believe that inflationary coins don't really provide as much of a ROI for investors as a coin with no inflation or even better: deflation.  Of course, you probably *need* some sort of inflation to ensure the survival of a coin that is only used as a currency (like DOGE coin for example, lol).  But you don't need the inflation to ensure the survival of a coin that is used for more than just transferring value, a coin that will be used in all sorts of fun games.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: I came into the crypto scene in 2012, when I was buying my first Bitcoins for $10-20. I never held any for too long though. In 2013 I sold 12 BTC for $100 each, just a few months before it peaked to over $1000. Ever since then I've been flirting with the idea of making my own coin. But this never really became a reality until June of this year when I decided I will actually do it. I've seen way too many incompetent developers, way too many scammers. I've always asked myself the question: "Why did these people abandon their projects?" "There was so much money for them to make if they just... kept on working...".  Then I realized the truth: If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself. Nothing was going to change the reality, stupid devs will keep on making coins and running away with the money, leaving so much potential go to waste. Something had to change. Too much of my money was wasted on very promising projects with bad developers.  So, I combined my love for programming with my love for cryptocurrencies and my love for games into one idea: Billionaire Token.  It started out as a fun project, just a small experiment. I was curious to see where it would go: So I did it... Now, three weeks into the ICO, we're reaching a point where things start to become serious - it's not just a fun experiment anymore, and I am very much prepared for the challenges that lie ahead. I will do my absolute best to make Billionaire Token great, truly great.  At this point it's not even about money anymore for me. It's personal. Competition turns me on. I always strive to be the best. I truly believe my project has a very good chance of being one of the top actors in the crypto-gambling and gaming scene.  One thing to think about is: I have said before, if the EOS blockchain delivers what is promised: A superior platform, faster, better, stronger than Ethereum and everything else that is available today, then we will most likely become the first decentralized gaming platform running on the EOS network. A member of our team has already started learning EOS decentralized application development. We also have many more games waiting to be announced - so stay tuned for these, they will be entertaining to say the least.  Quote from: hohbob on September 20, 2017, 08:32:13 PM sent for the daily 70% bonus again!  0x24bb438f0a41fd3e75a13fbde053742c8b69661ef9afbae294fab47657f039aa  Congratulations,  You are a Billionaire!  Amount of ETH sent: 9.5 Base XBL for [9.5] ETH is [27191.945] tokens for a price of $286.231/ETH. Total XBL for [9.5] ETH is [46226.3065] tokens with 70% bonus  TX ID: http://etherscan.io/tx/0x375519ef5c5037dd0955b0f0cd701cf221c4852427b80aeee5cd5692e10bd077

Author: Champion123
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: They are not greedy, it's part of their business/marketing plan. First, you attract people with low prices/low entry barriers and then you increase them gradually as time goes on and as your market share increases as well. It's what every major corp does in the real world too.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: You also have to admit: Cryptopia making their own cryptocurrency, DOT Coin, and setting up their shop to receive DOT coins was a very good business move. It's creating demand for it, a lot of demand.  This is what we are doing with XBL, making our own cryptocurrency that will be used as time goes on, in more and more games by more and more people in order to create demand for it.

Author: Champion123
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Yes! With one big distinction: Your supply is only 3M, which will shoot up the price 100x more for the same demand. Of course the industries are different, but the demand for gambling is more than trading, otherwise the casinos would be empty. This is so exciting... but I think you will have to reduce the Raffle price as demand increases to keep demand going for it as well which is the main deflationary mechanism of the coin and what makes it quite unique.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The Raffle is made with scalability in mind, so changing the ticket price further down the road won't be an issue. There will be a while until we get to the point where we will need to reduce ticket prices, though.

Author: Champion123
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Yeah, you are right. Also, can you see who has entered before in the Raffle and with how many tickets before you enter yourself?

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Right now, having that kind of information made public might be a security vulnerability, we first need to come out with a different way of generating random numbers from inside the Raffle Smart Contract to make the raffle_bowl (the variable that holds the address and tickets information) public.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hello everyone,  We want to anounce a small change in the Token Sale model.  The last three days of the ICO will have a 30% base bonus each. During these last three days, starting from day #29, for every 1 ETH, 0.1 BTC or 5 LTC contributed, the mystery bonus will be increased by 1%.    Another example:  Let's presume that during the last three days, there are a total of 34 ETH and 0.5 BTC contributed by a number of people. At the end everyone who contributed during these three days will receive 30% base bonus plus 39% mystery bonus (34 ETH + 0.5 BTC) for a total of 69% bonus on their XBL purchase.     The more everyone buys, the more everyone gets. All of the XBL associated with these purchases will be given out at the end of the 3rd day, with the mystery bonus included.

Author: cryptznbloodz
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hey guys. What's up billionaires.  I want to reveal that I am "the original" XBL whale. You guess which address is mine.   Other then that, I am a crypto trader/enthusiast/consultant. I don't claim to know everything, but I'm slowly learning.  I would like to fill you guys in on why I chose to hodl this ERC20 token above other ICO's. It's difficult to maneuver through the crypto-space lately. Teams approach investors hat in hand, promising "moon" prospects, but end up taking months to get going. Crypto empires are built up or tore down overnight. If you've been in this space for the past few years, I'm sure you've witnessed the growing pains and volatility that seems inseparable to the market.  I can tell gluedog is serious about this project. Just like anything in tech: If you want your idea to succeed, objectives need to be set and achieved realistically. His intentions are clear, without maliciousness.  I just want to congratulate gluedog on having a successful ICO. That's saying alot in the current state of the market. The whole bitcoin/ethereum "ICO" community continues to suffer losses due to geo-political intervention. Anyone that invested ETH early in XBL now feels hurt, but that's volatility for you. Unless you held ETH sub 300 USD days, then good for you.  Crypto is all about facilitating economic freedom and anonymity, removing the individual from governmental control. That's what DPR was attempting to create with Silk Road.  Anyways, I hope this gives you guys hope. Don't go into this expecting instant gratification, but invest in the long-term! I already see progress being made with the cryptopia enlisting.  Cheers and God Speed!

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We have began the process of buying DOT.  DOT is used to pay the listing fee for Cryptopia.  Most likely Cryptopia will be our first exchange. After getting listed on Cryptopia we will apply for a coinmarketcap listing (so people have time to buy rather cheap XBL before it gets on coinmarketcap).  And after we're listed on Coinmarketcap and Cryptopia, we will apply for HitBTC and/or Nova.  After that we will start the next phase of our project, which should be very very exciting. More info to come. We will be releasing some very important news!  Also stay tuned for this weekend, as we are releasing the Hillbilly ANN and Whitepaper

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: I would also like to give a little bit more information about the Raffle, because many people are still unsure how exactly it works and why it will be successful.  Basically, the Raffle works in the following way: Users must first call approve() on the XBL Contract Address allowing the Raffle to spend tokens on their behalf. After this, users must call the registerTickets() function on the Raffle Contract Address with the number of tickets they want to register as an argument.  Example:  Code:     function approve(address _spender, uint256 _amount) returns (bool success)  The user will first call approve(RAFFLE_ADDRESS, 20000000000000000000) on the XBL Contract Address. They have just approved the Raffle to spend 20 XBL (+18 zeroes) on their behalf.  Code: function registerTickets(uint256 number_of_tickets) returns (int8 registerTickets_STATUS)  Assuming the price of one ticket is 20, then the user must call registerTickets(20) on the Raffle Contract Address.  Now you're in. You've just registered a ticket to the raffle. You have the chance to become the grand winner!  All of this is easy for a cryptohead but might seem just a tad bit complicated for your average gambler.  We will be aiming to go mainstream with Billionaire Token and as such we will develop a GUI to be used in conjunction with the Raffle and the Burner . This GUI will use Metamask and will be usable through our website initially. We will also be looking into developing stand-alone clients.  Basically, people will play the Raffle, play with the Burner, play Poker and not even know they're on a blockchain. It will be gambling for the masses with all the benefits that crypto currencies and blockchain technology brings: accountability, traceability and security.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We would ideally want to have a system in place where people can just use their credit card, buy XBL tokens and just play. Without even knowing they're on a blockchain or that they are using cryptocurrencies.  Behind the scenes, a script would go on exchanges, buy XBL for the cheapest available price, and send it to the user's wallet.  Bringing crypto-gambling to the masses means bringing this sort of technology to people that might not care too much about Crypto Currencies or Bitcoin or XBL. However, they do care about having fun, fair and auditable games where nobody can cheat, they care to have fun.  There is an easy way we can do just this - bring crypto gambling to the masses -  with the help of our Raffle and Burner GUI, our Poker game client and our system where people will be able to buy XBL with their credit cards.  The most exciting thing about going forward like this, is that if only just a small group of people start playing regularly and buying XBL for our games, the extremely low supply will mean that the price will be drastically affected upwards.

Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: I have many great ideas, things that I wish to accomplish with this project. Too many ideas, too little time.  This week I will have a meeting with a team of developers that might join our project. They will help us develop Billionaire Hold'em faster.  If everything goes well we will want to go public with the whole team (linkedin profiles, etc.), most likely sometime in the near future.  We will keep you updated as things progress.  Right now, our main focus is to get the Raffle and Burner deployed and working before we hit the exchanges - so that our token will not be in any danger of being banned/delisted because of state laws regarding securities and futures. If our coin will have a use-case right away, then it is not a security.     We will most likely be listed on NovaExchange first. The other exchanges we are looking at are: Cryptopia, EtherDelta, HitBTC, Livecoin.

Author: Champion123
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Sorry if I offended you. It was supposed to be constructive, but nowadays I see tens, even hundreds of ICO-s every single month coming out. The first thing an investor sees is the website. To truly differentiate yourself from the other hundred ICO-s, the website needs to be at least on par with the industry standards. If you chase people away from the site, they won't even read the whitepaper or anything else that helps them convince to invest. I don't know, maybe I look at everything from a marketing/UX (user experience) perspective, but that website truly needs a re-design. I can give you some recommendations if you want, but since you are a developer, I guess you already knew a lot of stuff about that.  Anyway, another concern is the fact that if someone buys in more than 15% of the tokens, you will have a problem with the distribution system as you said so yourself. The buy limit however does not resolve this problem. In the banking world, it would. But in the crypto world, all you need is an address to get the money. And in your case, an address + an email. You think an individual cannot create tens of addresses & emails and buy a lot of coins for himself under different aliases? If that happens, once the ICO is over, you will have an incredible pump/dump situation in your hands.

Author: lukunku
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hello, I have a question about the raffle code:     function getRand(uint256 upper_limit) returns (uint256 random_number)    {       /* This will have to be replaced with something less predictable.    */       return uint(block.blockhash(block.number-1)) % upper_limit;    }  Why is the Raffle's random number generator have to be replaced with something "less predictable" and why is it predictable?

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Everything that the contract sees, the public sees. Using a blockhash means that the miners can influence the result of the random number generator to a certain degree. They could conceivably have a chance at the prize per block they mine.  We can do a few things to avoid anyone from cheating this way (although highly unlikely they will be able to even without the following measures):  1. Change the random number generator to be externally seeded from a source like random.org. This would mean that we would have to trust random.org, though.  2. Make the raffle_bowl mapping private before releasing the raffle - so that nobody can see what position they are in the ticket queue by just watching this variable - they could still however check the blockchain explorer and see how many people called registerTickets() during that week, although they would not see the return value of this function (so they wouldn't know if those tickets got registered or not).  3. Not generate the random number in registerTickets(), but have an external script call a function checkWeek() every week on the Smart Contract so that even if we use the blockhash to seed our random number generator, so it will be impossible to find it and so users will not be able to influence the result of the Raffle.  Just implementing #2 will give us the level of security that a decentralized Raffle system needs, however we'll implement even more safeguards to guarantee a fair game.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hello,  We will first focus on having a deliverable product that is competitive enough to merit the increase in user base which will eventually drive up demand. Once we have this product, advertising and keeping users interested will be our primary concern. At this point is when we will start to dedicate more time and money to the marketing side of our project. Things like getting well-known poker players to talk about our platform and offering very competitive (or zero) commission on all of our games are just some of the things we will want to do.  None of the above matters though, if the poker game and the rest of our games will not live up to the hype. Right now our focus is on succesfully finishing the Token Sale, getting the Raffle and the Burner deployed as soon as possible so that our coin has a use-case right away after the Token Sale - which will keep us on the legal side of things (there have been all of these ICO bans in the US, Canada, China etc. and we do not want to be put in the position where we would have to refund our customers and stop the project). After stage 3 and 4 of our roadmap are finished ("Raffle and Burner go online" and exchange listing) and our deflationary mechanism works flawlessly, and the community is actively engaged in the project (thus creating a network effect where new investors flock in consistently) we can drive our full attention to the Billionaire Hold'em game.  And only after all of this, does marketing really become important. We need to have a competitive product if we wish to have a successful marketing campaign on top of that product.

Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm

I have decided to build both the Raffle and the Burner with scalability in mind - this means they will be constantly updated with new fun features and functionalities (yes the Raffle and the Burner will probably get even more fun as they evolve together with our project). And let's not forget new security updates and so on - we can't have anyone stealing those Billionaire Tokens or cheating:)  I am also looking at the idea of implementing even more Smart Contracts that work together with XBL tokens so that people can have even more fun with them. But first we will focus our full attention on getting the first versions of the Raffle and Burner up and running on the Ethereum network.  On top of this we will begin work on a GUI (Graphical user interface) for the Raffle and Burner. This will definitely make it more appealing to the masses.\  We will have a series of Alpha and Beta tests for the Raffle and Burner before implementing the production versions of these two Smart Contracts. We are committed to bringing you very high quality software:)

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The Raffle and Burner will be written in Solidity, this is a programming language that is similar to Javascript and it is designed to target the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). The compiler will then transform this solidity source code into bytecode that can run directly into the EVM - on the Ethereum Network - thus creating decentralized applications that will be entirely independent and self-sustainable.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: The current news is quite worrying, first the SEC started to crack down on ICOs that were selling "unregulated securities" and now China is banning all ICOs.  However, we do not believe that Billionaire Tokens are securities. They will have a use-case right away after the token sale via our decentralized Raffle and Burner.  All in all, Billionaire Token is a self sufficient gambling system at the base of which lies an ERC-20 Ethereum Token, that will work together with two other decentralized applications deployed on the Ethereum Network. These two Smart contracts represent the core of the deflationary mechanism at the heart of everything. All of this is experimental, it has never been done before in the way we are doing it. We can not and will not make any guarantees about the future value of Billionaire Token.  None of our team members are from the US or CHINA. This ICO is not based in any one country either. We are a bunch of people from all around the world that are building open source, decentralized software for fun.  We have stated before that we will do our project no matter how many tokens we sell, we do not need these funds to finish our roadmap. Many projects start development after their token sale, we have started it before and are working on delivering the first part of our roadmap and a complete deflationary system by the end of the 31 days.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hey ifrietpani. There's nothing to hide, it's just that at this point in time we're not sure we want to go 100% public and show our names.  I'm in the process of quitting my job and because of this, right now I can't show my linkedin profile over here and link it with this personal project of mine. The way I see it is like this: On the odd chance of the market crashing, or any other sort of unpredicted failure I will be in a very bad position had I went public with this. My team and I will still continue the project no matter what happens - however if it does indeed crash I would not be able to go forth with the plan that I have to quit my job and go full time crypto-developer. So I would need it. I would need to keep the job I have to sustain myself.  But I wouldn't be able to keep it if they found out I had any other sort of personal project - it just doesn't work that way where I work.  What I can tell you at this point is that, if we are indeed succesful with the ICO (and by the looks of it - it's going quite great), and we will have enough funds to keep the project going and we go to a point in time where I finally realize my dream of being a full time crypto-developer, then i will link my linkedIN profile here.  About the legal structure, we are in collaboration with a legal representative that will advice us on moving forward. You are absolutely correct, if we will be allowing people to instantly buy XBL tokens from us, or instantly fund their gaming accounts with credits (so they don't even know they're playing on a blockchain) we will need to have the legal structure into place.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Rake system is one thing we will be looking at doing. However we are dedicated to bringing the lowest and most competitive fees on the market. We are also looking at implementing our own blockchain in the future, doing a 1:1 swap and having masternodes. Holding the premine is just another way we will be profiting from finishing our project.  The Billionaire Hold'em software will be released under an open-source license. We are looking at the idea of allowing community members to run the game on their servers, thus creating a truly decentralized gambling platform. Incentives for this will be in the form of comissions that every community members will gain if they host the game servers - hosting a table or more tables if you will. This will ensure the continuation of the project even if one central authority (like our company) fails because of different legal or environmental factors.  The Raffle and the Burner will be fully decentralized and once they are deployed they will not be influenceable by Billionaire Token in any way. Billionaire Token does not take any sort of payment/comission from the raffle or the burner. They are fully decentralized and autonomous.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We're not promising anyone anything. No lambos, just humour. It would be insanity for me to promise people Lamborghinis  The reason why we didn't automate the token distribution was because we couldn't allow citizens from states that do not permit the buying of Ethereum tokens to participate in the ICO. We needed a more "personal" way of distributing the tokens. This is why we require everyone who wants to buy tokens to create a user on our website.  If we had created a smart contract to automatically distribute tokens to everyone who sent ethereum, then the ICO would not have been legally compliant.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Card counting doesn't really apply to our, online, on-blockchain blackjack games. In land-based casinos, much of card counting centers on knowing the deck penetration, or how far into the shoe the dealer is before decks will be re-shuffled. This is very important information to card counters because they need to know how many decks there are before spreading their bets. Seeing as how you’re able to watch the dealer in land-based casinos, it’s actually possible to get an accurate deck penetration figure.  But in our case, the software does all of the shuffling so you don’t get to see this in person. Worse yet for card counters, is the fact that the virtual deck is shuffled every time, meaning they never have an opportunity to get deck penetration. This being the case, it’s impossible to count cards in online blackjack with any sort of confidence.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Well, as we have explained the raffle will be an Ethereum Smart Contract. It will be open-source so everyone can read the code. The code will pass through a series of security audits and peer reviews before being deployed. You can just look at the code and tell everything the contract does. So there is a 0% chance of hiding anything or cheating etc.  The "house" doesn't get anything from the raffle. It will function on its own on the Ethereum network, outside of our control.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hey, I just sent the transaction. Should be confirmed in about 2-10 minutes.  Quote from: MrHeron on August 29, 2017, 04:15:33 PM Quote from: gluedog on August 29, 2017, 04:08:58 PM Quote from: MrHeron on August 29, 2017, 04:03:14 PM Quote from: gluedog on August 29, 2017, 03:59:29 PM Quote from: MrHeron on August 29, 2017, 03:56:42 PM Quote from: gluedog on August 29, 2017, 03:45:26 PM Quote from: MrHeron on August 29, 2017, 03:36:24 PM Quote from: gluedog on August 29, 2017, 03:32:42 PM Quote from: Yankeeruinx on August 29, 2017, 02:25:14 PM So which exchanges are you thinking of hitting first? Also if all the tokens are sold before the ICO finishes will this push forward the date when they will be listed or will you be sticking to the original schedule?  We're going to try for Cryptopia first, and then the rest of the exchanges listed in the first page.  Quote from: MrHeron on August 29, 2017, 03:14:41 PM Quote from: dakovic on August 29, 2017, 05:42:05 AM Quote from: fishfishfish313 on August 29, 2017, 01:16:06 AM Quote from: eggsandspamm on August 28, 2017, 10:06:06 PM Quote from: cryptogaga on August 28, 2017, 09:40:40 PM I read this up and down and still do not understand what the burning of coins you guys mean, is it that holders of you coin will choose to participate in a burn process or it is automatic for all holders?  In order to reward deflation this coin was rewarding users with 125% of coins burns as a reward but I believe that bounty campaign has since ended.  Yea, people were quick to burn what they had, depleting the Bounty account.  The raffle will have a burner smart contract implemented.    Quote Another key ingredient to the deflationary mechanism that is embedded into Billionaire Token is the Decentralized Burner Smart Contract. The Burner receives 20% of the tokens that are sent to the weekly raffle.  Quote The weekly Become a Billionaire decentralized raffle will be the basis of the deflationary mechanism for Billionaire Token. Every week, users can send 20 XBL to an Ethereum Smart Contract address – this is the equivalent of buying one ticket, more tickets mean a better chance to win. Users can buy an unlimited number of tickets to increase their chances. At the end of the week, the Smart Contract will choose three winners at random. First place will get 40% of the tokens that were raised during that week, second place gets 20% and third place gets 10%. From the remaining 30% of the tokens: 10% are burned – as an offering to the market gods. The other 20% are sent to another Smart Contract Address that works like a twisted faucet – rewarding people for burning their own coins. The Become a Billionaire raffle Smart Contract will run forever, and will have an internal timer that will reset itself every seven days. The players are registered to the Raffle by creating an internal mapping, inside the Smart Contract, a mapping of every address that registers tokens to it and their associated number of tickets. This mapping is reset every time the internal timer resets (every seven days).  I am sure that a more thorough guide will be created for users who may not be familiar with Smart Contracts.  The way I understand it, is the Burner must be "called on" to burn, and must have the tokens (the 20 percent received from the raffle) or it cannot burn any tokens.  So, the more people who play the raffle, the more tokens will be in the Burner.  10 percent are burned immediately, as an offering to the market Gods lol . .  So, over time, the supply will diminish.  With the upcoming poker game, which should be going because the ICO looks like it has been successful already, even in it's third day . . this will create demand.  Demand on exchanges as well.  Demand for the raffle.  And demand for the Burner.  All in all, a good formula for economic gain.  Are the devs going to put a limit in how much can be burned?  Like lets say the supply has burned down to 1m left, will they still keep burning?  I'd like to know the answer to this, maybe your cut off is 100k?  There is no limit to how many coins can be burned. The amount burned will be a percentage of all the coins sent to the raffle.  So obviously as the supply will get lower and lower, this percentage will mean less and less coins getting burned.  We'll let the users decide how many coins will be burned, we won't impose any limits on that.   So what happens if there's only one person to put in for the raffle?  Do they get their money back automatically?  Is their a limit to the number of people who can participate in the raffle?  Like 2 ppl - to a maximum?  Yes, if there are 2 people or less participating in the raffle they will get their money back.  There have to be three or more people (accounts) that participate in the raffle for it to work as described.  So is there a maximum or no?  Does the smart contract allow for their to be an unlimited number of participants?  That is correct. The contract will allow for an unlimited number of participants.  What about security?  How can we be certain that teh integrity of the raffle say from in house cheating?  Well, as we have explained the raffle will be an Ethereum Smart Contract. It will be open-source so everyone can read the code. The code will pass through a series of security audits and peer reviews before being deployed. You can just look at the code and tell everything the contract does. So there is a 0% chance of hiding anything or cheating etc.  The "house" doesn't get anything from the raffle. It will function on its own on the Ethereum network, outside of our control.  How about from malicious attack?  Can someone 'hack' the raffle without someone being aware?  Or could someone stack the odds in their favor by entering into the raffle with multiple accounts? I'm sorry I don't know a lot about smart contracts.  I am glad you asked.  This is exactly why the code will pass through a series of security audits/ code reviews before being deployed. We want to make sure it is completely non-vulnerable to the exploiting of bugs in the programming logic.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: We're going to try for Cryptopia first, and then the rest of the exchanges listed in the first page.  Quote from: MrHeron on August 29, 2017, 03:14:41 PM Quote from: dakovic on August 29, 2017, 05:42:05 AM Quote from: fishfishfish313 on August 29, 2017, 01:16:06 AM Quote from: eggsandspamm on August 28, 2017, 10:06:06 PM Quote from: cryptogaga on August 28, 2017, 09:40:40 PM I read this up and down and still do not understand what the burning of coins you guys mean, is it that holders of you coin will choose to participate in a burn process or it is automatic for all holders?  In order to reward deflation this coin was rewarding users with 125% of coins burns as a reward but I believe that bounty campaign has since ended.  Yea, people were quick to burn what they had, depleting the Bounty account.  The raffle will have a burner smart contract implemented.   Quote Another key ingredient to the deflationary mechanism that is embedded into Billionaire Token is the Decentralized Burner Smart Contract. The Burner receives 20% of the tokens that are sent to the weekly raffle.  Quote The weekly Become a Billionaire decentralized raffle will be the basis of the deflationary mechanism for Billionaire Token. Every week, users can send 20 XBL to an Ethereum Smart Contract address – this is the equivalent of buying one ticket, more tickets mean a better chance to win. Users can buy an unlimited number of tickets to increase their chances. At the end of the week, the Smart Contract will choose three winners at random. First place will get 40% of the tokens that were raised during that week, second place gets 20% and third place gets 10%. From the remaining 30% of the tokens: 10% are burned – as an offering to the market gods. The other 20% are sent to another Smart Contract Address that works like a twisted faucet – rewarding people for burning their own coins. The Become a Billionaire raffle Smart Contract will run forever, and will have an internal timer that will reset itself every seven days. The players are registered to the Raffle by creating an internal mapping, inside the Smart Contract, a mapping of every address that registers tokens to it and their associated number of tickets. This mapping is reset every time the internal timer resets (every seven days).  I am sure that a more thorough guide will be created for users who may not be familiar with Smart Contracts.  The way I understand it, is the Burner must be "called on" to burn, and must have the tokens (the 20 percent received from the raffle) or it cannot burn any tokens.  So, the more people who play the raffle, the more tokens will be in the Burner.  10 percent are burned immediately, as an offering to the market Gods lol . .  So, over time, the supply will diminish.  With the upcoming poker game, which should be going because the ICO looks like it has been successful already, even in it's third day . . this will create demand.  Demand on exchanges as well.  Demand for the raffle.  And demand for the Burner.  All in all, a good formula for economic gain.  Are the devs going to put a limit in how much can be burned?  Like lets say the supply has burned down to 1m left, will they still keep burning?  I'd like to know the answer to this, maybe your cut off is 100k?  There is no limit to how many coins can be burned. The amount burned will be a percentage of all the coins sent to the raffle.  So obviously as the supply will get lower and lower, this percentage will mean less and less coins getting burned.  We'll let the users decide how many coins will be burned, we won't impose any limits on that.

Body: I'm very curious how you take security "very seriously" and yet think that since your MX and A DNS records for your root domain go through third party alllllll the other DNS records you have for your domain are automatically hidden from the world, which all point to servers in Romania.  I only ask since I am legit considering investing in the ICO, I like the crazy deflationary system you guys have put together, but I've seen more then my fair share of scams ( not call yours a scam ), and alot of them run servers out of Romania, Bulgaria, and alike to avoid any legal intervention.  Just putting it out there. If you can put my mind at ease, im in..to da moooon.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Oh that's quite the faux pass there  Even though the server isn't apparently completely hidden, I am pretty sure it's not easily broken.  So to answer your question: I am from Romania myself, and I chose to use a local hosting company since it's cheaper and easier. And if I can keep the money in the country, even better.  Also I don't think I can avoid legal intervention just because I am from Romania. The FBI or SEC could easily come and get anyone anywhere. There was this one guy who hacked NASA, he was Romanian, he got busted by the FBI pretty easily because he bragged about it on his blog.  If I wanted to avoid legal intervention I would buy some bitcoin VPS from an offshore company or something similar.

Author: gluedog
Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: Hi,  The Raffle and the Burner Smart Contracts lie on the Ethereum Network and they are self-sufficient. Nothing would happen to them even if we did leave this project.  The Billionaire Hold'em poker game will be an open-source Texas Hold'em game, that will connect to the Ethereum blockchain to provide proof of it's random randomness - Every game will be audited. It will not be possible to cheat at this game, even if you control and run the server. I guess that the community will just take over and run their own server with their own copy of the Billionaire Hold'em game.  So to summarize: After we have finished our roadmap, the project will be self-sufficient and not dependant on us - The Billionaire Token Team. We will be running the official version of the Billionaire Hold'em poker game, we won't just make the game and leave

We have also explained how the Billionaire Hold'em poker game will be linked to the Ethereum Blockchain as to allow anyone to run an audit of every game that was ever played and thus ensure fairness to all participants.  What you are saying here does not constitute compelling arguments against our project. You are not a real FUDSTER. You are not even trying.

Title: [ANN] Billionaire Token - Games on the Blockchain! 🔥 Deflationary Algorithm
Body: That's the reason our Token Sale takes place over a period of 31 days. We are running a marketing campaign as well. We certainly do not want to sell too few Billionaire Tokens - because then the distribution would not be proper and it could hurt the project.  Ideally we would like to sell at least 33% of the total number of Tokens (3,049,999 XBL) in order to ensure a proper distribution, we have big ideas for the future and I think that the only thing that could hurt our project is either:  1. Selling too few tokens (less than 33%):     We hope that this is not going to be an issue with our current marketing campaign.  2. Someone buying too many tokens (more than 15% of the total supply)     To address this we have decided to put a limit on the amount of funds someone can send to the ICO: 5 BTC or the equivalent in ETH or LTC
